item.title: Country jolted awake by strong tremor
item.description: A 5.7-magnitude earthquake jolted Dhaka and several other parts of Bangladesh on Friday morning, according to the Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD). Felt between 10:38 am and 10:39 am, the tremor lasted for about half a minute. The epicentre of the earthquake was in Madhabdi, Narsingdi,

item.title: IDCOL requests Tk10b support for installation of 300 MW green power
item.description: Infrastructure Development Company Limited (IDCOL) has now turned its focus on promoting rooftop solar systems for both industries and public infrastructures. In this regard, IDCOL is seeking around Tk 10 billion in credit from the central bank to finance the installation of an additional 300 mega

item.title: Shah Arpin Tila in Sylhet now gets iron gate to protect stones
item.description: SYLHET, Nov 20: The 138-acre Shah Arpin Tila in remote Companiganj upazila was almost levelled by the organised groups of stone looters during the last one year. However, the looting started during the last regime as political gangs were there and the administration failed to operate even amid pro

item.title: Physical work unlikely to start despite feasibility study, DPP
item.description: Physical work of electric traction on the rail-track from Narayanganj to Joydebpur is unlikely to start soon despite completion of its feasibility study and preparation of development project proposal (DPP), estimating the cost at Tk 39.33 billion. Sources said approval of the DPP of the Dhaka-Joy

item.title: DUCSU holds conf’ce with elected reps from 18 halls
item.description: The Dhaka University Central Students' Union (DUCSU) organised a special conference with elected representatives from 18 residential halls of the university. The event was held on Wednesday night at the Nawab Nabab Ali Chowdhury Senate Building on the university campus. The conference was chaired

item.title: Govt cracks down on unauthorised interior works in Secretariat
item.description: The government has issued strict directives to curb interior decoration and unauthorised repair works inside the Bangladesh Secretariat in Dhaka, aiming to strengthen fire safety and prevent future accidents, sources said. The move follows an investigation that found unregulated "beautification" a

item.title: Three pedestrians die as quake causes railing collapse in Bangshal
item.description: Three pedestrians have been killed after an earthquake caused a railing to collapse from a five-storey building on KP Ghosh Street in Dhaka’s Bangshal. Rafiqul Islam, chief of Bangshal Police Station, said: “A railing from a five-storey building collapsed and fell amid the earthquake.&

item.title: Australia launches jt campaign to combat visa fraud
item.description: Australia has joined its international partners in a coordinated campaign to raise awareness about visa scams as part of International Fraud Awareness Week, warning that fraudulent agents are increasingly targeting would-be migrants across South Asia, said a spokesman of the Australian High Commiss

item.title: Commoners facing the brunt of winter vegetable price spiral
item.description: Unseasonal early-November rainfall has pushed up winter vegetable prices across Rajshahi, and Sylhet districts piling pressure on consumers already battling against the rising living costs. Our Rajshahi correspondent reports: Untimely downpour in early-November caused extensive damage to winter ve

item.title: Gaibandha farmer makes cattle feed out of banana stems
item.description: GAIBANDHA, Nov 20: A farmer of remote Hazirhat in Sundarganj has been using banana plant's stems, or portions forming the trunk-like structure, to produce a new processed fodder item for cattle, and addressing feed shortage in the area. The fodder from banana stalks are as cost effective as it is

item.title: Three DU students injured after leaping from hall buildings amid quake panic
item.description: Three students of Dhaka University have been injured after they leapt from the three-storey Hajji Muhammad Mohsin Hall and the four-storey Muktijoddha Ziaur Rahman Hall in panic as a strong quake rattled Bangladesh on Friday. A student from Muktijoddha Ziaur Rahman Hall is believed to have broken

item.title: FEAB Foundation holds seminar on food and agribusiness development, innovation
item.description: The FEAB Foundation organised its 7th International Seminar on Thursday (November 20) at the International Convention City Bashundhara (ICCB) in Dhaka to promote food and agribusiness development, safe food production, and technology-driven innovation.
